history.content:
Maker Applications due Monday, November 30 at 11:59 PM
Free Registration for Attendees (link below)


Techfair at Berkeley

December 5 - 11am-5pm

Hosted on Hopin


Hello!

We wanted to let you know about Techfair at Berkeley - MDB's annual conference for student makers!

If you're working on a side project or startup, you don't want to miss out!

Techfair at Berkeley is UC Berkeley's premier conference for student makers! Applications are now open for undergrads who're working on side projects and ventures. Last year, Techfair featured 50+ student presenters with 400+ attendees. Top teams were awarded equity-free grants - and one funded team later went on to raise $500K through Kleiner Perkins & Human Capital.

This year, Techfair is going entirely virtual – and is expanding to include student makers from across all nine UC campuses! Presenters will have opportunities to showcase their projects and products, connect with other makers, and pitch their ventures to investors. Techfair will also feature some incredible keynote speakers as well as equity-free funding for top teams. The conference will be on Saturday, December 5 - applications are being accepted on a rolling basis at https://go.techfair.dev/apply/ and are due Monday, 11/30 at 11:59 PM.

If you're not currently working on a project, feel free to attend and check out other student projects and startups! Registration is free at https://hopin.com/events/techfair-at-berkeley/.
history.subject: Techfair at Berkeley
